magical sand world
item.description:
imagine a desert world with sand as far as you can see.
This sand is magical. It is dream material. You can shape it into whatever you want!
As a child, you shape the sand more and more into the most wonderful of images!
The shaped sand takes on properties based on the shapes of your "sand castles"!
You can see the properties, you can hear them, you start to simulate experiencing them and the wonderful feelings and emotions that come with them!
One day, as your magical sand world becomes more and more fleshed out with the most beautiful of ideas, images, and experiences you start to recognize that it is absolutely the most wonderfully incredible world! And the stark contrast between your magical sand world and the real world.
naturally, after simulating experiencing all those wonders, you develop a strong desire unlike any other to experience them for real! You start to seek your magical sand world dreams in the real world!


If you are lucky enough to
Be born
cisgender
healthy and capable
mentally
physically
Into a
capable, loving, and supportive family
Perhaps even including your cousins and/or grandparents
To raise you with love and good skills and values
Truly supporting your wellbeing, happiness, and success
And financially stable
Without financial struggle to stunt your development
Perhaps even wealthy
owning a house or several for you to live in, with the freedom to grow and blossom in, in peace
favorable geographic location
favorable country
Without
poverty
corruption
Without
devastating natural disasters
With
Either neutral, or even supportive community
Without
discrimination
bigotry
hostility
That allows you to, or even supports you with seeking your dreams
Good social circle
Good peers
Perhaps even a true best friend, or several
Then great!! Make sure you focus on your dreams and don't forget about them over silly distractions. And if you do, oh well! You can always continue essentially from where you left off. Perhaps it's even more magical now, to revisit your dreams and find them just as beautifully wonderful, if not more than you remember!
And if you are instead like the majority of people:

Your seeking of your dreams will unfortunately and unfairly be met with friction and resistance.
Soon you notice that your "sand castles" seem to have become taller..? Further away..? That's odd...
Then you notice that you can see less of the horizon. Have you become shorter..?
You look down at your feet and realize that while you were battling the friction and resistance of your troubles and struggles of the real world, the weight of it has caused you to sink down into the sand.
That's concerning! Or rather, it would be, if you weren't so drained and exhausted from your constant battling, and if you were lucky enough to have enough energy leftover: also from dedicating the rest of your energy into figuring out how to possibly improve your living situation, or at least plan for the future.
Years go by, and you recognize something! A sand castle you built who knows how long ago!? It's beautiful!.. Or rather, you remember how beautiful it was...
It really only resembles the beauty and wonders... You can only recognize it because you have memories of this fallen over, mostly crumbled chunk of sand that no longer sparkles magically like it did in your memories, sinking past your feet into the sinkhole that is oh-so-bigger than the last time you noticed it...
More time passes and... For the first time in your life, something truly, undeniably magical happens!!! You see one of your "sand castles" in the real world!
suddenly, the sinkhole stops. And not only does it stop, the "sand castle" you discovered gets rebuilt, even more breathtakingly magnificent than in your magical sand world dreams from your childhood! Because you have grown, and are So much more ready than you possibly could've been back then! And because this is real!!! This is it! You held onto your dreams with all you could, and the waiting is over! Now you can Finally start living your dreams!!!
You are as grateful as you've ever been in your entire life by an incomparable magnitude of difference, concluding that while the pain and suffering you endured was horrible, unfair, and absolutely undeserved: You could not mind it one bit anymore, because it paid off! It was all worth it! The hope, the happiness, and the sheer euphoria you are experiencing Completely nullifies all of that, making it a thing of the past that is So insignificant and powerless right now and forever on, that it feels like it will never again be possible and you have absolutely no reason to dedicate any part of your energy to it. You have discovered one of your "sand castles" that you knew was real! You never gave up and now no one and no thing could Ever take this knowledge, this experience away from you because you have witnessed and experienced it for yourself, like you always knew you will!

The story could've ended here. Goodness, did I wish it ended here.
I sincerely wish you don't lose your "sand castles" or your sand altogether, like I did mine.
My "sand castle" was going to be enough for me. It was my net positive. My hope. My escape. My chance at freedom. At being heard. It truly outweighed all the cruelty, abuse and trauma I was going through every single day of my "life".
I knew it wouldn't fix my troubles. I never had such unrealistic fantasies. With my net positive: I could finally breathe and see a future. I couldn't ask for more.
All I ever needed was to to be heard, to be seen, to to be valued. Someone who truly wants to hear me, someone who truly understands me and what I am saying. Someone who recognizes me as a person that I am, someone who recognizes my value, and someone who truly enjoys and cherishes me for me.
All I ever needed, wanted, and sought for was my kin.
Far too soon - "soon enough" being never in a lifetime - it was all ripped away from me. Together with my hopes, my dreams, my feelings, and my ability to experience anything, whether it was positive, or negative. I have entered an experienceless limbo. No matter how much I wanted to physically scream, shout, and cry: I was no longer able to. My voice and tears became unresponsive. I truly had nothing left. Not even the resistance against the sinkhole. It was all gone.
With time: The sinkhole devoured everything I ever held dear. I was so deep in it, and yet I couldn't even express my fear, my helplessness, or my pain. I was truly numbed.
I went through the motions instinctively to what felt right to my core, exposing myself to things that once brought me feelings and emotions to see if anything can help me. Things I enjoyed and cherished, held close to my heart more than anything. unfortunately and cruelly: I could replicate no such results.
I felt nothing, I experienced nothing. The only thing I could sometimes recognize was the torment, and the overwhelmingly crushing weight of the despair.
New sand would come, at a lesser and lesser rate, yet the rate of the sinking was overwhelming. The sand levels were at a net negative. At that rate, inevitably, all the sand and the magic with it sunk away. All I had were my memories, buried deep inside my mind, inaccessible in this negative state of mind.
There were a few rare feelings and experiences that lasted for perhaps 10 seconds, maybe up to a 30, or even a minute. Like pride and excitement over something truly incredible I have created. And then it's gone, as if it was never there. They were like bonus sand that carried some magic with it. Yet only a little bit. No match for the sinkhole.

~5 years in, a spark partially appeared in the real world. It was online, but it was real. I didn't quite understand what it was. The spark almost immediately recognized me. Turns out she has heard of my creation, and she was inspired by me, and she admired me!.. That... Flew over my head. I did not understand how that is possible, or what it meant. I couldn't truly grasp the concept of that being something that could be experienced towards >me<..? I wasn't even myself... That just did not make sense to me. Yet I understood it at the same time, and I also recognized her back, too.
She was not being consumed by the ravenous sinkhole. How curious..! It's as if she is a constant, resembling me so, so much... And... She has interest in... Me..? But... I have interest in her also. It was so natural and right, yet the connections in my mind felt like they never happened. Though the results were there. I learned that while I cannot experience things, things still do occur, and I do process them.
While I couldn't understand why she was interested in me, it completely made sense to me that she would be, it was like the common sense of my core. I concluded that I don't have to understand something as long as it feels right. That I need to trust the guidance of my intuition, of my core. Afterall, my core has never failed me, never gave me any reason not to trust it. I always chose my core and I am so glad for it.
She reminded me of... Me... The resemblance was as undeniable as the connection we shared from the very beginning.
She wanted to spend time together with me. We played starbound together while on call. I would normally not be on calls. I didn't like my voice that was wrong and that I could barely use in the first place, and I had no one to talk to on call either. Yet I didn't think twice about being on call with her.
She was being gentle, kind, and patient with me. Like I am precious, like I have worth. I felt free enough to act like myself. And it felt right to do so around her.
She thought like I did, valued the same things, and in the same way in relationships as I did, and she recognized the same things as I did, to the same depth. I was filled with curiosity, like this is someone really important to me. Almost as if she was... One of the "sand castles"..!?! That's right, I had "sand castles"!!!
unfortunately, she had her own troubles. She trusted me enough to confide her troubles in me.
unfortunately again, I screwed it up and hurt her by communicating Super poorly since I had next to no social skills.
She disappeared for over a month over that, yet the spark didn't fade. Not in intensity anyway, only through distance.
Finally I received another message from her. And I screwed it up once again, less this time. I tried my best to be careful, appropriate, and gentle, though I was feral. The only way I knew how to do that was by expressing as accurately as I could, without knowing the words for the concepts I am trying to express. (The rabbithole of me dedicating myself to improve on this eventually became this! The entire vault! So that I could express myself better than ever! I could never allow myself something like this to Ever occur again! She is the first person in my life that is consequential to me.)
fortunately, she recognized that I never had any malicious intent. That I only ever meant well, and that I am trying my best.
That wasn't enough however, and through the kindness and kindness of her help, I managed to break through and to Finally apologize despite not fully understanding the cause. I instead apologized for making her feel bad, which allowed us to course correct. It meant the world to me! Quite literally, actually!


I was taught an essential lesson that day.
It doesn't matter what you did to hurt someone's feelings. What matters is that you did hurt their feelings, and that your effort and dedication to making it right is a direct indication to both yourself and them to how much you value that person, their opinions, and their feelings. How much they are worth to you. That you recognize them as someone important to you, someone deserving of you dropping whatever you may be doing, whatever you may currently understand, and whatever you currently believe in, and focusing on them to make it right .
You do not need to understand why their feelings got hurt in order to... Fully know what you're apologizing for..? It sounds like getting confirmation that they got hurt, which is stupid and illogical! You were told the issue! You were told the answer! You know their feelings are hurt!!!
I don't even understand that logic, it's crazy how it made sense to me some day, and I am grateful that I will never be like that again!
You were just told by the one person that knows how they feel the best, more intricately and accurately than anyone else could ever tell you!!!
Not recognizing this fact is rude, inconsiderate, and devaluating! It tells the other person that you don't trust in what they're confiding in you, that you don't believe how they feel!? That's ridiculous! And frustrating!
If you have hurt the feelings of someone you value and trust, it absolutely does not matter if you understand why or how you did that, or why or how they got hurt in contrast to how critically it matters in the moment that their feelings are hurt! By you, nonetheless!!! T_T
When you learn that you hurt their feelings:
It costs you nothing to stop and take a break, to tend to them, to make it right.
re-evaluating your facts and understanding is Far lower priority than tending to their feelings. Show that to them!!! Show their worth to you! T_T
It costs you everything to prioritize your opinions/knowledge seeking over their feelings, showing how wrong, thoughtless, and cold/insensitive your priorities are to intentionally choose to postpone their feelings, to invalidate them and hurt the relationship with that person by doing so, to further hurt their feelings after they reached out to you, misplacing their trust in confiding in you to let you know that their feelings got hurt in the first place. It is a quick way to ruin a relationship.
It costs you the relationship. It costs you a happy future together.

Any new sand that is created passively or from events of significance would still get sucked up into the sinkhole, yet with knowledge of her existence: at a lower rate.
As she was the only (and first) person I ever recognized to such an incomparable magnitude, I set out to see if she could perhaps meet my criteria for some I could call my friend one day. A word I had reserved for someone more special and magical to you than the people that other people call their best friends, their boy/girlfriends, or even their wives/husbands in some cases. I didn't know what the correct word for this concept was back then, but I could conceptualize it. Today I know (funnily, I learned the word from her) that the word I was looking for was kin.
unfortunately, while I recognized that we potentially could achieve a bond that close together one day, making progress in developing our relationship was being made very difficult by her struggle of keeping in contact.
Every message of hers I would receive was always positively received and welcomed, yet the scarcity of them was very difficult on me. I wanted to be close, to bond. And I have learned that it was mutual. Yet we could not make progress in it, to a point where I would vent to my friend about the inconsistency and unreliability of her contact with me and the difficulty that causes me through tears. She was the most important person to me, and our relationship felt on hold.
I was missing our bonding. Our experiences that would make us express our enjoyment of the other and the significance for the other, to the other. They were very significant to me, they made me feel like I was finally making progress in my life in something that is important to me. I could recognize that through experiences like that an the bonding through them: my rate of sand could increase through exposure to new and positive things, and the sinkhole's rate decrease through the memories we make. depending on how she is after getting to know her closer, perhaps the sand could even start to sparkle again! Yet that was in the past now. We were so close, yet so far apart. It didn't sit right with me. Yet I couldn't do anything on my own. relationships are both-sided, and I had done everything I could, everything I was capable of to reach out and bond while maintaining the balance of the relationship, giving me no choice but to continue exercising patience by once again waiting indefinitely.
The rate of the sand going away was still a net negative, yet the improvement from knowing that she exists remained constant. I had someone important to me in my life. Someone I recognize. important enough to be a positive in my life, despite both of ours struggles.
It was like that until a bit over 1.5 years later. Even though the situation still did not sit right with me, I had long ago accepted that there is nothing I can do further on my own about the situation and did what I could to disengage from it. I knew it wasn't her fault, that her struggles are simply stronger than the energy she has to dedicate to changing that. And who could blame her for dedicating her energy into mending her daunting daily life issues, rather than something less urgent feeling.
Our priorities and values can only truly be changed by ourselves. And while it hurt, I knew there was nothing I could realistically do.
One day I asked for a favor of her that only she can accomplish. It had taken her somewhere between a week or few, to a month or few per a progressing step. I wasn't surprised. I was already familiar with how she is and asked for the favor fully knowing it would take a very, very long time. I figured she would like to help me and it would give us an opportunity to communicate again.
Another day after several months of no updates from her side I asked about the favor. She realized that she had forgotten about the favor entirely, and the full weight of it Finally came crashing down on her, snapping her back to reality. How much of my trust and faith she must have lost by neglecting me. She felt So sorry because she values me, and yet she knew how much she screwed up with me. She expressed that I am her best friend, and that surprised me so much. It baffled me. I had disengaged so far into having no hopes in her engaging with me again for the foreseeable future that I could not comprehend how she could see me like that, with how neglected I was by her. Yet I was so, so grateful to hear that that's how she feels about me... That she's still here, that she remembers and values me... And I was not upset at her. I was upset at the situation, our difficulties, and lack of the experiences and bonding we used to share so closely and intimately. She finally dedicated herself to changing this, to spending time together with me.
And she was right, I had lost hope in her. Yet behind all that hurt, I admitted to her that I naively still do trust her and I am really happy she feels this way about me, about us. And that I am excited to see the results of her new determination!
I felt this way because I truly recognize her as a person with feelings, hopes, struggles, dreams, imperfections, and desires. Like myself. And unlike everyone else. She is such a constant, just like I've also always been. Someone with an unwavering personality, someone with a core. Something I have always complained others not to be. She truly is a true person I recognize. She undeniably is of a special kind, our kind. As long as she tries, I can forgive her. And she has dedicated herself to try, to regain my hope and faith in her.
It was all really touching and emotional, I cried so much. She Finally opened up up about her life situation and how bad everything was and is going. It was all So incredibly relatable, and we got to bond once again.
And so she did! Rarely, but we played games! And oh my goodness, the contrast of how many shadowplay recordings I saved with her, as opposed to a small fraction with others - it's truly something else!

There was some more sand coming in now, yet unfortunately, my life was headed into more and more numbing stress and difficulty. education, work, and a horrible "partner" that ruined me even further, to a point of deep depression. So deep that the self preservation instincts of my core would kick in daily. So many red flags, absolute relationship crimes that my "partner" would be committing. It was horrifying. I got beaten down so incredibly much. All I could do was hibernate, to self preserve by hiding my true feelings and thoughts away. I had broken up up with that thing mentally far before >it< heard anything about it.
My sand income was essentially zero. sinkhole at an all-time high. I was So numbed, so depressed that I could experience none of it. I would randomly start crying with a blank expression. I did not feel like doing anything.
One day I invited her (from the spark section) to play something with me and >it< (the "partner"). And oh my goodness, >it< mistreated her So fucking badly that I was mortified!!! >It< went fucking insane and attacked her, spewing absolute and fucking nasty BS at her.
I could not comprehend how someone can be so evil, such a heartless monster, to treat someone so lovable, kind, and sweet like that!!!
I felt so very sorry for her! And really badly for exposing her to something like this.
I got reminded with a burst of sand how much she means to me, how much I love her, how important she is in my life to me!
She expressed wanting to to spend more time together with me and despite the friction from >it<, I am So glad I recognized her offer and decided to spend more time together!
She expressed to me how much she loves me and I expressed the same to her also! Though being so numbed still: I recognized how wrong it feels to be able to express such beautiful feelings so weakly. It did not feel appropriate to me. I expressed this to her and how I find it not okay and that I dedicate myself to correct this unfairness, to healing to a point and beyond where I could adequately express my feelings to her, and give justice to it!
One day I finally broke up with >it<.
We now had so much more time to bond with her.
We started scheduling spending time together from once a week, to twice a week, to considering a third day, where I timidly asked her what she thinks about just spending every day together, and instead worrying about which days not to spend time together on... It was like she never even heard that second part. She was So into that idea and I honestly did not anticipate that much success... I thought: since it's quite a bit of effort scheduling days over and over again, perhaps she would be interested in just dedicating days to spend time together... imagining what it'd be like to just spend every day together, but not actually expecting it... worrying about suggesting such a thing, partially because While I can imagine all the things I understand, I can't by definition imagine my imagination's blindspots, and what if she doesn't feel mutual about it..? It's scawy!
I cannot describe how grateful, proud, and happy I am about how it turned out!!!
We got so very close and loving! We thought of a name for our unique type of relationship, and she suggested platonic girlfriends. That was Sooo adorably precious, sweet, and heartwarming that I just couldn't! I >>>felt<<< Soso happy and giddy! I felt loved, I feeling seen, I felt valued! I felt wanted! I felt hopeful, and looked forward to our future!
Another day - after more and more bonding and connection - that went up to platonic wives~
With us sharing our dreams and desires: came a bunch of magical sand! Not only reminding me what my "sand castles" are, but also receiving hers! And also shaping new ones together!!!
I have finally achieved a net positive! I had sand!!! I had dreams! I had hopes!
unfortunately the sinkhole, while reduced in size after the wonderful developments - it was still taking away far too much for comfort! And it was >it<'s fault!
So I dedicated myself to learn how to handle it, and soon enough - through a whole bunch of newly-found energy from the magical sand - I finally managed to break through >it<, and get her to recognize, and fix her shit!
I now had a far more sustainable net positive, one where I don't have to fear Nearly as much about >it< spoiling it!
With magical sand comes hopes, dreams, and fantasies. including plans for the future. One day I was sitting and thinking, then fantasizing over what it would be like to have her at home. Even if all she did was cooking, my quality of life would increase dramatically! This thought wouldn't leave my head, so I decided to be vulnerable with her, and share my fantasy...
She loved it!!! We started sharing more and more fantasies together over what it would be like to live together, and she dedicated herself to making it happen! So wonderful! I will have a future!? Oh my gosh, oh my gosh, oh my gooooooshhhh!!!!!! And it's not too good to be true!!! It's mutual!!!!!
Despite the fact that my sinkhole is still eating up my memories of my feelings and experiences to a point where I lose them, it's no longer scary. I know that we will make more and more and more. allowing those fears to no longer hold even a fraction of the power they once did.
The stability through her is like an impenetrable shield. It has never wavered, and I know it never will. It protects me from desperation and transforms fears of unknown, to excitement and fantasies of the unknown that we are, and will continue experiencing together! Because I now have a loving wifey, and a future with her!!! Where I am heard, understood, and valued! And share those feelings back!
It truly is a game-changer to have kin. "You have discovered one of your "sand castles" that you knew was real!" ;p


"sand castles" are dreams~
dreams are the source of motivation, desires, and fantasies.
sand is a base, something to work with, something you can shape into goals, motivation, desires, and magical dreams! Which are shaped from the goals, motivation, and desires into something specific. Something you can grasp, simulate, and express.
sand is the energy/food/motivation that allows your mind to heal and grow, to be positive and hopeful, to thrive despite any awful circumstances, to live.
sand is dream material. You need sand to shape dreams out of, to create them. Because dreams are made of sand.
Though you can have sand and not to have dreams regardless.
That's because sand has quality.
The majority of peoples' sand is abundant and pale. Of poor quality. It doesn't sparkle, it doesn't shine. It's often not even used to make dreams, because it's not potent enough. It's uninspired. It just kind of supports peoples' lives and they are complacent with that. Don't know any better. It's enough to feel okay, to enjoy their time. pale sand, pale goals.
The more the sand is magical, the more wonderful the results!
sand comes from inspiration, admiration, and positive experiences. Something that shows you without a doubt that there is more to this world and life. That some things are truly magical, and wondrous. Something that catches our attention and entices us, makes us feel, that once we experience: we can never go back, as it has become a part of us.
Our mental state determines how much sand we are able to acquire.
The better our mental state is:
The more good quality sand we can acquire from the most simple of sources, such as looking at nice nature, or watching a nice show.
The worse our mental state is:
The less sand we receive from our sources, at worse quality, with more effort required.
The more difficult it is to access positive memories, which is one of the sources of sand. (memory access)
The more our sources of sand become cut off, the worse our mental state becomes, creating a stronger and stronger sinkhole through a self-feeding loop.
The less we can develop dreams to guide us, because we are either missing the sand, or it stopped sparkling with magic.

mindset
item.description:
The passive way your mind is.
During periods of better, or worse than usual - your mindset shifts.

If your mindset is low - you will be less likely to recognize anything changing.
Worse will not seem that bad. Even if you would fight it with your life during a healthy mindset.
Good will not seem all that significant, perhaps not even recognizable.
negative mindset is the lack of feeling and experience. It is numbness.
If your mindset is high - you will be more likely to recognize change.
Worse things will seem wrong, dangerous, and very undesirable. Rightfully so!
Good things will seem better, more meaningful, and more significant. Rightfully so!
positive mindset is the feeling and experience of Life.

feelings that tell us something is feels off, that there is danger, whether it's from a known, or an unknown source.
causes us to experience negative emotions.
negative feelings are just as important, if not more important than positive feelings. They are important warnings for us, without which we would be oblivious to the potential imminent dangers and pitfalls.


feeling suspicious of someone's intents
May help you avoid or even prevent danger, such as being taken advantage of, hurt, or even being physically or emotionally harmed.
The antonym to this would be naivety, or obliviousness.
feeling anxious, scared, and worried about where your future is heading
If you live paycheck to paycheck, or worse: go further in debt every week/month.
recognizing that your friends aren't actually behaving like your friends and are instead taking advantage of you, and feeling used.
So whenever someone suggests to you that negative feelings are "bad", imagine how your life would continue without them.

obsessive ambivalence
item.description:
When judging something or someone: We immediately pick a side first: positive or negative. Especially for topics we don't understand or people we've never meeting or properly interacted with!
Example:
What is your opinion on AI?
You probably picked a side the moment you saw it. AI is great, or AI is terrible. But what do you actually know about AI? It's a Far too complex to label as inherently Good or Bad.
What is your opinion on vaccines?
This is one of the reasons that there are idiots fighting against vaccines. They interpreted a side based on their past knowledge of the topic, even though in reality: They know virtually nothing true about this topic. Probably only myths and propaganda.
Yet we as humans immediately pick a side, before we think about the topic.
Many end up never thinking about the topic, yet defending their belief regardless.
Don't be like them.
challenge your initial assessment with facts and logic.
research and study the topic to get a good understanding of the concept.

reaction formation
item.description:
A defense mechanism where an unwanted or negative feelings inducing feeling or thought is transformed into its opposite.

If you judge something to suck, yet for some odd reason cannot forget about it and cannot pinpoint why you think it sucks: You probably love it and are in denial about it.
This is a common case of reaction formation often seen in children with crushes, specifically emotionally immature/insecure boys that cannot admit they have positive feelings towards someone, and would rather automatically default to attempting to fool both themselves and others that they instead have negative feelings about that someone or topic. Anything to deflect from the fact that they do have positive feelings.
This is absolutely not exclusive to kids. Adults, typically emotionally immature/insecure ones utilize this defense mechanism rather commonly.
A girl thinking she hates a guy that she cannot stop thinking about, because she cannot stop thinking about him, especially if the thoughts are positive.
May say bad things behind his back to her or his friends or family members.
A guy thinking he's really cool and people who disagree with his view are "haters" and hates them himself, while loving himself and his self-image even more to subconsciously compensate further against the disproving facts.

reluctancy

remembering
item.description:
We remember feelings and emotions most effectively and accurately compared to fine detail, words, images, etc... For all of which we summarize instead. But not feelings/emotions.
When we remember a feeling - we have no doubt that we recognize it.
We can even recognize feelings we either feel incredibly rarely, or have last felt an incredibly long time ago, or have never felt before. Yet it makes sense to us and is natural to us.
Like experiencing love and kindness after not having any for most of our lives, or ever so genuinely and truly.
Yet we can walk a path we've walked on before, perhaps even numerous times, hear a concept we've heard before, hear a word we've heard before and think it's the first time we are experiencing, and not think much of it. Can even swear we never experienced it, because it is not as intuitive and essential to us.
evolutionarily: feelings and emotions are one of the most primitive concepts that sentient beings (like us humans) can experience.
We've had them for far longer than we had thinking, reasoning, or conscious thoughts in general.
They are so incredibly core to us; we understand them incredibly intuitively.
feelings and emotions are like the lowest level language of all sentient beings.
This is part of why trauma is so effective, and so incredibly difficult to get rid of, especially without the right mental tools.
words are an incredibly powerful tool for sapient beings (like us humans). Yet we developed these tools Far after we developed feelings and emotions, which makes them not as effective/intuitive as feelings and emotions for us to understand intuitively, which are far more at our core of experience and understanding.
We can feel and experience just fine even when we are at a bad enough state to be unable to think properly.

reward
ridiculousness
ripping
ripping away
rosy retrospection
item.description:
recalling events more positively than they actually occurred, "Through rose-tinted glasses".

This is done by our minds for all memories, including memories that were:
positive
How in awe you were when you first met someone you love very much right now, the first moment you saw them.
in reality: you did recognize that person immediately, more than anyone else, However, I doubt you were immediately in awe. The truth is that you have just met the person and lacked the information you know now that makes you remember it so much more rose-tinted.
rosy retrospection does not diminish the true events, nor the memories. It is a wonderful process that our minds utilize to cherish, be grateful for, and appreciate the people that are important and loved in our lives even more and keep them close to us and make sure they are safe, protected, and happy <3
neutral
How fun and enjoyable a mundane task was
In reality: It wasn't particularly enjoyable, nor was it tedious. It was mundane. Perhaps 90% of the task was spent doing the same thing over and over.
Yet we remember it being better than it was, because it was useful to us. It accomplished a task that wouldn't normally do if there was no reward attached to it. It's a great motivational technique our minds utilize!
negative
How much you learned and how useful those skills and information from your education were.
In reality: it was actually an incredibly inefficient, tedious, and stressful wasteful of your time, energy, and resources. Perhaps even your emotions and mental health, perhaps you even suffered trauma from that experience, yet your recollection of that period of time tells you differently, even though you know it's wrong.
This is useful for us because it helps us to accept and forget the past, to leave it behind, and moving on, instead of dwelling on the past, and it's injustices, and getting nowhere in life. We are resilient! We learn, we move on, and we blossom~ <3
Being aware of rosy retrospection does not only not diminish the positive effect and usefulness, but it actually enhances it! It allows us to look at things in retrospect, and appreciate things, bringing us gratitude <3
For negative ones:
It allows us to recognize how much we have moved on, how insignificant our pain and suffering from the past is now, in the present. How our present lacks all that awfulness, and gives us gratitude that we have something so much better now <3
For neutral ones:
It gives us immense pride and admiration of ourselves, of our dedication and persistence to accomplish such seemingly crazy and difficult tasks. imagine! spending hundreds, perhaps even thousands of hours studying subjects you find interest in, for your own sake alone, without the ability or even the desire to brag, be admired, or even recognized. Only for the sake of learning, growing, and improving yourself as a person. Yeah, who'd do that! ;p
For positive ones:
It shows us who had stuck by our side in our lives, through the difficult times, and the wonderful times. Who were there for us and helped us when we had no one else. Who cared for us and gave us kindness. Who we will always cherish and who we will never, and can never forget and will always love, cherish, and appreciate <3
